:ptv-victory:
That face needs an emote, asap
Which face? Also, hello Aspiring
Flora's
Also, SERIOUSLY?  Turns out that work tried calling me not only yesterday, but today
New Year's Resolution: Find a new job. Lol
Good idea
Yesterday I was wrecked after work
One of the dishwashing machines I need to use stopped working in the middle of the after-lunch plate rush
I'm already scheduled for 5 days this week.  It was originally 33.5 hours but after staying late / coming in early, it'll be 35 min after the next two days
Ouch.
And I need to do some work for my other job today
I often stay in after I'm meant to finish up myself.
There's always a little bit left to do.
So I effectively work 6 days this week.  And I go back to the first job for 4 days in a row after this
So, very busy schedule for you.
That stinks...
More like they need to do their f*cking jobs and hire more people
I'd say so.
I saw a hiring sign by the freezers but NOT on the front door
Umm...failed a spot check there.
They should have it on the door definitely,
We are guaranteed going to be losing 1 employee in the next few months
Job that bad?
She's going to the community college for her CNA, and will be applying to a nursing home mid semester
I'm working in a nursing home myself.
Kitchen catering.
That home will have a max pay rate of $18.75 an hour, and I think the min is $12.5
Wow. That's good.
Sure as hell beats the $9.5 here
I get about €10 an hour for 8 hour shifts
But double pay on Sundays
We have another employee a year younger than me who just got his degree in computer science (just like me :D)
Which I sometimes work
Neat!
And while his availability is opened up, he does not want to work more than 24 hours a week
I see.
You know, job search.
Then there's me.  I have 2 jobs, 1 I enjoy more than the other, and I'm just WAITING for an excuse to drop hours
Well, I've worked Monday and today, work again tomorrow, two days off, then I'm on Saturday and Sunday.
And on Monday next is my exam
Into college at 9:00am sharp.
Books ready
To own that paper
It's been quite a humbling experience.
Part of the reason I want to cut hours is so that I can hone my programming / art skills.  Maybe not the former P
I'd have thought that IT programmers are in demand.
I wanted to develop video games but noped out of that idea very quickly
Still, there could be work as an IT specialist
Fixing computers and whatnot
I don't know...
Honestly, the gas station is ridiculous
I'm not that good at coding to be honest. (Although I need to become fairly good ASAP if i want to work with Geographic Information Sciences and the Surveying Programs and instruments)
We have maybe 1 part timer working below 20 hours.  And I think it's 16.
And corporate keeps wanting to cut hours so stuff keeps piling up
Is there a lot of traffic coming through there?
A decent amount.  But you know corporate
Know fuck-all about how stores actually run, and only care about their precious numbers
Yeah...profit first, people later
Idiotic, to say the least
If they paid more attention to people than numbers...
"Your store isn't getting enough sales, we need you to cut 100 hours off a week"
"But... we need those hours to get vital maintenance tasks done-"
"NO. LOW SALES. CUT HOURS."
Not only would there be more employee retention, because people would actually want to stay in the jobs because they were being treated properly...
In the end they could end up making a steadier, more sustainable income.
It's kind of the same here.
I'm just waiting for UBI to become implemented
Nurses from hospitals are all going to the UK because in Ireland it's just not good enough.
Not a ridiculous version, but what's known as "Minimum Basic Income".  AKA, enough money to stay above the poverty line
I see
Well
I'll just say, best of luck with the jobhunt
Want to know why I'm waiting for UBI? :P
There's many reasons, but one in particular I find very appealing
To search for a better job, and make more art?
The overall improvement of "minimum wage" jobs
Oh, are they getting better?
Quite literally, if people are making enough money to LIVE without needing a job, jobs that are shitty and / or treat their employees like shit / replaceable aren't going to survive
I think I see.
Because they won't NEED to keep those jobs for any reason other than the extra money
There are some jobs that are minimum wage, but that are absolutely vital to the running of society.
I assume wages for those will have to go up.
Stuff like council work and street cleaning.
minor repairs
Cleaners
Etc
The problem with most retail positions is that corporate views labor as a cost, and not an investment
Stupid idea.
So they want to get the maximum value out of that labor that they can
Without labour, the flipping shops wouldn't really run.
If sales go down, they will cut hours to save their profits / the bottom line
fumes
Where are you from, again?
British Isles
Half English Half Irish
Okay, so here in the US we have a home improvement store called Home Depot
Ok
For the longest time, the company was highly regarded because of its well treated and knowledgable sales staff
Uh-oh, I see where this is going.
Decent pay, decent benefits, actually knew stuff about home improvement / construction
Then in the late 90's / early 2000's, they got a new CEO
Corporate higher ups started looking for more profit, didn't they?
Bingo
And because they cut corners, overall quality went down?
He started eliminating full-time positions and replacing them with more part timers.  Saved the company a lot of money on benefits
But like you said, their legendary customer service no longer existed
It just seems so counter-intuitive to me!
Their knowledgable full-time staff were replaced with part-timers to save money on benefits, and the shopping experience tanked
It's like Mr Kornada's robo-lobotomization plot in Freefall.,
Incompetency is a requirement to climb the corporate ladder
All short term gain comes at expense of total economic collapse
That's the entire problem!
Blegh, I really hope that the trend is broken.
All these companies want their short-term numbers to look good
The AAA games industry is on the verge of another collapse because they're chasing this exact trend
EA comes to mind
And to be honest, investors are just as much to blame, as well as our legal system
You see, the funny thing is that publicly traded companies are REQUIRED to make money for their investors
It's just ridiculous.
And investors want sustained indefinite growth
...which is impossible.
Yup, but if you DON'T play the game, they can sue the company for not fulfilling its duty
Because somewhere, things will either plateau or go down.
And what, pray, would that 'duty' be?
To make them an ROI
So, it's a three-fold problem that lies almost entirely with the way public trading is setup
Sooner or later it's going to crash down again.
We're already heading that way
And who's going to feel the pinch?
Us.
Oh yeah, no.  If we have ANOTHER taxpayer bailout of huge companies, we might have literal civil war, lol
To quote Mr Pump the Golem from Terry Pratchett's 'Going Postal'...
"When the banks break, it is seldom the bankers who go hungry"
These companies keep running themselves into the ground and expect US to bail them out.  Meanwhile the people at the very top pocketing all the profits don't pay a damn thing.
Here's to the trend breaking over the decade.
To the higher-ups being replaced by those with common sense.
And to those who look past the short-term profit.
We can hope, and vote.
Here's what will break the trend
Private companies who DON'T play the stock market game
True, true.
There are plenty of those on the rise, I know.
Look at Disney.  They've been buying up companies left and right.  And it's predictable
And those who have sustained themselves for many years.
They're more or less saturated their respective markets, and NEED to expand in order to please the investors
Oh, Disney is a GIANT.
Yeah, it's only a matter of time before the government steps in to break them up
I am glad with what it did for the MCU, but it will eventually fall...hard.
Here's to the Underdogs.
because the Underdogs always find somewhere soft to bite...
I've been laughing at Fallout 76 all year, haha
Anyhow, I am going to head for the night.
I'm going to read chapter 11 and go to bed...
Night!  if I ever get my youtube under control, maybe I'll find more indie games to watch ;D
Cheers!
play*
See you next year, XD
I wanna play Undertale / Night in the Woods...
Oh! Before I go...
Noodley dreams
Night in the Woods has been a Godsend of a game...
It helped me get out of a dark spot, and find motivation to get a job.
Hmmm, might push it up a few places in the backlog, then
I'd say it's right up there with Halo and Undertale in my favourite videogames.
And by that I mean 100 - 150+ places, ahahahahaha
XD
Well.
Goodnight
Cya tomorrow
WoW's a bitch :P
Night!
Happy New year!
